benchmark_details.name: ZERO-SHOT AUDIO CAPTIONING VIA AUDIBILITY GUIDANCE
benchmark_details.overview: We propose a novel zero-shot audio captioning method that addresses the challenges of fluency, faithfulness, and audibility. Our method employs transfer learning from three neural networks, culminating in a dataset carefully generated by ChatGPT that contains audible and inaudible caption samples.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To introduce a zero-shot audio captioning method that enhances the audibility of generated captions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The solution does not effectively identify or distinguish between multiple speakers or sources of sound within the same audio segment.

data.source: Generated by ChatGPT using prompts designed to create audible and inaudible caption samples.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparisons to ground truth captions.
methodology.interpretation: The evaluation shows improvements in audibility and overall quality of captions.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared to a baseline where no audibility guidance is applied.
methodology.validation: User studies indicate 86% of users prefer the audibility-guided captions.
